content: I just noticed that it now is! https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.zulip.flutter. Apparently it was released two days after my previous message. It's an early preview but it can be installed alongside the standard app, which is nice.
The link appears to be dead.
Works here, but try searching for "Zulip (Flutter beta)" in the Play Store.

This is crazy, I only see
image.png
Not available in france / US, perhaps?
I can see it on my phone. But the flutter app doesn’t seem to allow authentication through GitHub so I cannot access my account.
You can read about the status of the Flutter beta, including caveats and known limitations/bugs, along with instructions for joining it, here.
It currently only supports password authentication.

We intentionally have not announced it broadly yet, since it's still an early beta. We'll be advertising it more widely when we have a more feature-complete version ready (for instance, including non-password auth).

Screenshot_20240222_084119.jpg

eee looks like this, but I've just realized that my phone's Android version is 12, not 13.

A few observations about the beta app.

  1. It is much slicker and neater than the current Android app.
  2. So far I have not had the kind of network connection issues that I have with the existing app.
  3. Things like math mode sin⁡(x)\sin(x)sin(x) seem to work and code quotations work.
  4. There is no dark mode yet.
  5. The initial screen could show us the views section of the desktop app including "Recent Conversations" for example.
Okay that was strange. Math mode seemed to work for me but now math is rendered as code

What's missing are the following:

  1. The aforementioned math mode rendering
  2. Message editing isn't available.
  3. Text formatting is rendered incorrectly (but the app gives a meaningful error message).
  4. The loogle bot doesn't work. I am not sure if this is just loogle or all bots.
  5. Drafts do not appear to be saved.

What's "the loogle bot," and how does it not work?

Other than that, I'm pretty sure all those missing items are known, and you can track their progress on the project board. If you have specific questions or feedback, #mobile > Flutter app is the place to leave them.
@loogle Nat
:search: Nat, Lean.defaultMaxRecDepth, and 36558 more
seems to work
Screenshot_20240222-121744.png
@loogle Rat
:search: Rat, instDecidableEqRat, and 1306 more
In the normal zulip app, loogle works in private DMs too
Oh wait. This might be a mistake on my end
That looks like a DM with yourself. Even if you @ other people (or bots) in your DMs to yourself, other people (or bots) can't read them and respond to them.
Still an early beta, but it supports GitHub auth now!
On Android at least
It's pretty much the same code on both iOS and Android, so all Zulip Flutter builds have that support now.
Just gave Zulip Flutter iOS a try, seems smooth, Github auth also works. No dark mode though.
I'm particularly looking forward to see Recent conversations view, but there seems to be little news on that.
Dark mode is being actively worked on right now. Recent conversations is marked as in the "post-launch" milestone, so I don't expect it to be getting much attention yet.
